Well, here we go. Last race for any of the NASCAR series from Homestead.

(which, in my opinion, is a dumb place to have the final race, but I digress)

 

So, in Cup, who will win?

Will 5 time become 6 pack? (Johnson)

Will The Robot prevail? (Kenseth)

Will Happy defy the odds? (Delana's wife, Kevin Harvick.. sorry - long running joke there)

‎11-15-2013 07:06 PM

Formula 1 is in Austin, Texas this weekend at the beautiful Circuit of the America's track.

And, we folks in the US and Canada can actually watch an F1 race without getting up at insane hours of the early morning.

The actual race coverage is scheduled to start at 2PM EST. If you watch nothing else, be sure to watch the start.

F1 always starts the race with the cars at a dead stop, no "flying start" as in most series.

It is usually the most exciting 60 seconds of any type of racing ever.

 

As usual, I wish my Scuderia Ferrari the very best of good fortune. I also hope FingerBoy loses an alternator in the first lap.

 

Kimi Raikonnen will not be in the race, as he is having back surgery. Hence, I had to make big changes to my Fantasy teams.

Weshallsee. (Kimi speak)

 

Forza Ferrari.

‎11-17-2013 06:46 PM

Congratulations to "He who was 5 time but is now 6 pack", Jimmie Johnson on winning the NASCAR Cup Championship.

You gotta hand it to this team. They prepare and practice for everything.

Some people say his crewchief is a cheater.

I say Chad does his best to operate in the "Gray Area" of the rules.

Sometimes he gets caught, sometimes he doesn't.

Smokey Yunick is proud of Chad.

*Smokey was one of the original "Gray Area" guys in motorsports.*

 

Also, huge Thumbs Up to Dale Junior for the very best season he has had in a long time.

I can't wait to see what the Jr / LeTarte team can pull off next year.

 

Damn... now we gotta wait until February. *sad face emot*

‎11-17-2013 09:13 PM

And a big congratulations to Denny Hamlin the winner in today's race.  This guy has had a rough year and I was happy to see him take the win!!!!!  His win sort of lost with all the hoopla at the end of the year stuff.

 

 

My Kudos to Danica Patrick for a really nice statement regarding Mark Martin....who just happens to be a favorite driver around my household

 

 

Swan song for Martin

 

Mark Martin's 882nd career Cup start Sunday was his last. Subbing for the injured Tony Stewart in the No. 14 Bass Pro Shops/Mobil 1 Chevrolet, Martin qualified 22nd and finished 19th.

Martin, 54, last weekend in Phoenix said he has declined offers to keep driving next season. He is expected to assume an advisory role with Stewart-Haas Racing. SHR driver Danica Patrick will welcome his input.

 

"Some of it's about driving, but a lot of it is about team and about communication and about what we need to improve overall as a team from somebody like Mark Martin that has so much experience and has accomplished so much," Patrick said. "He has seen a lot of different teams. That is a great perspective. He is there to [answer] driving questions, but he is also there to just help overall from a team perspective."

 

A five-time runner-up in the points standings, Martin has 40 career Cup victories.

 

"The road to success is always under construction."
- Lily Tomlin
